page.title: 17South Hiendley
page.content: South Hiendley has a population of 1,738.The village has 4 shops,2 pubs (The Fox &The Sun) 1 church,1 chapel,2 W.M.Cs and a parish hall which is used for activities of the village such as: Derby & Joan club,youth club, disco, Mother & Toddlers, Brownies, 'keep-fit'classes and brass band. The 2 pubs,between them,run a fishing club,an allotment society and quiz and dart league teams. There is a 1st school which has 105 children and a nursery class of 39. Mrs.Devonport is one of 7 labour councillors.In S.Hiendley council meetings are held at the Parish Hall. The old vicarage is a hostel for unemployed men with 27 residents and 7 rooms.A bus runs every 1/2 hour into Wakefield.The mobile library visits every Tuesday.There is one surgery with 4 doctors.
